metadata.Title: CVE-2010-5107 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The default configuration of OpenSSH through 6.1 enforces a fixed time limit between establishing a TCP connection and completing a login, which makes it easier for remote attackers to cause a denial of service (connection-slot exhaustion) by periodically making many new TCP connections.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-5107` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:6.1p1-3
openssh-client-ssh1 - 1:6.1p1-3
openssh-server - 1:6.1p1-3
openssh-sftp-server - 1:6.1p1-3
ssh - 1:6.1p1-3
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:6.1p1-3
ssh-krb5 - 1:6.1p1-3
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> this is a long-standing problem with any server that limits connections. This requires conffile changes. mdeslaur> Upstream has changed the default MaxStartups to 10:30:100 to mitigate this issue. Sysadmins can change the equivalent config locally.  we will not be fixing this issue in Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, in environments where this is a concern, we suggest settings the MaxStartups value to 10:30:100 in the sshd_config file

criterions.comment: openssh package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:6.1p1-3').
